availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. Elmore Graham Skaggs in LaRue County, Kentucky, on August 11, 1859. Father of James R. Skaggs, Atwood Skaggs, Lafayette Skaggs, and Malissa Skaggs. Stepfather of Samuel Graham. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 691.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Upper Brush Creek Precinct, p. 511A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, LaRue County Marriages, Film 000409559.
"Willis Skaggs (1932-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 67291186, accessed April 17, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67291186.
